intro: Lysipomia laciniata, commonly known as the cutleaf lily or the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-gray, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Lysipomia laciniata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
